âš™ï¸ Implementing Quality Gates in CI/CD Pipelines Link to heading

Quality gates are automated checkpoints in your CI/CD pipeline that ensure code meets quality standards before advancing to the next stage. Here’s how to implement effective quality gates. ğŸš€

What Are Quality Gates? â“ Link to heading

Quality gates act as filters that:

  • âœ… Prevent problematic code from advancing
  • âœ… Provide fast feedback to developers
  • âœ… Enforce organizational standards
  • âœ… Protect the production environment

A Practical Quality Gates Strategy ğŸ“‹ Link to heading

Stage 1: Code Quality Gates ğŸ” Link to heading 

# Linting and formatting
- name: Run linters
 run: |
 npm run lint
 npm run format:check
 
- name: SonarCloud Analysis
 uses: sonarsource/sonarcloud-github-action@master
 env:
 SONAR_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SONAR_TOKEN }}

Stage 2: Unit Test Quality Gates ğŸ§ª Link to heading 

# Unit tests with coverage threshold

 run: npm run test:coverage

 COVERAGE=$(cat coverage/coverage-summary.json | jq '.total.lines.pct')
 if (( $(echo "$COVERAGE < 80" | bc -l) )); then
